name: Sylvia's Restaurant
address: 328 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

reviews.text: Uno de los mejores restaurantes que fuimos en NY, nos gusto todo desde la vibra del lugar, la atenciÃ³n, la comida. Pedimos un catfish frito con un wafle (que sirviÃ³ de almuerzo y postre) y ademÃ¡s un plato de otro pescado frito con dos guarniciones que fueron las verduras hervidas y un mac&chesse, del pescado me gusto mas el que vino con el wafle tiene mas sabor las guarniciones ambas estaban deliciosas pero el mac fue un nivel mas de rico. Pedimos un mitad te helado y mitad limonada muy rico que vino con un refill gratis otro detalle del lugar que ademÃ¡s fue el Ãºnico en dos semanas por USA que nos dieron algo de entrada para picar (que no nos cobraron) el cual fue el cornbread (pan de maÃ­z) calentito con manteca. La atenciÃ³n como lo dije fue excelente, la camarera siempre con una sonrisa y preguntando como estaba todo. Reservamos pero no hizo falta, habÃ­a lugares libres. Recomiendo compartir el plato, nosotros estÃ¡bamos con mucha hambre y no pudimos terminar la comida de cada uno.

We had a fantastic experience ordering catering for 100 people from Sylvia's. Their team was fast, responsive, and helped work with us to create an order that fit our budget and event. The food was on time, hot, and delicious! Highly recommend ordering Sylvia's for your next event.
We made a reservation for Sunday Brunch. We were seated right away. The food is always always great. The wait staff was slow
Great landmark havenâ€™t been there on over 15 years. Still on point down home soul food cooking

Simply great. Must visit when in Harlem. We got the pork ribs, fried chicken, string beans and mac and cheese (of course). Just real quality and real soul food. The service was fantastic as well and we were lucky to have come 10 mins after opening with no line. When we left there was a line out the door! Corn bread comes for free too ğŸ¥°

Best soul food weâ€™ve ever had! We ordered the bbq ribs and fried chicken combo, and it came with two side dishes. The portion was very generous so we barely finished. The rum punch was good too. The cornbread was warm and crumbly, 10/10.

Going to Sylvia's was a great experience! Previous to my arrival, I tried booking a reservation online but they were all taken for the number in my party. I took a chance and went directly to the restaurant. The staff greeted me kindly and explained that it would be a 10 minute wait. Meanwhile, they guided us to the outdoor seating area, which was heated. We were seated and greeted by our server, Dylan. He was great! He kept our drinks full, brought our food out promptly.
I had the catfish, crispy and seasoned well with yams and mac and cheese. The yams  were sweet but not to sweet. The Mac and cheese was flavorful but could use more cheese within the dish. One of my daughters had the appetizer wings, hot and crispy however a little salty for our liking. My other daughter had the chicken and Waffles served with a leg quarter which was also seasoned well. Daughter #3 had the chicken sandwich that was hot and seasoned well with fries. The fries were standard but hot and crispy. Lastly, my husband had the pork chops, vegeterian greens and rice. 1 pork chop was fried, crispy but a little salty. The other chop was fried smothered I  gravy. I didn't care for the gravy but it was decent. The greens were great. Well seasoned. The rice was well seasoned  and fluffy.
This was overall a great experience!

Food was good. Sweet Potatoes needed some spice tasted like Marshmallow Creme, and sweet potatoes with vanilla. Other than that Pork Chops were delicious.  Fried lightly. Service was slow even with a light crowd. Probably need more waiters, wasn't prepared to serve multiple people on a Tuesday.

The Yelp app deserves credit for this culinary discovery. Their pricing structure makes sense for the quality. The appearance here matters and shows. Team - superb - friendly and thorough. You should go and judge for yourself.

Sylviaâ€™s Restaurant is a Harlem institution that has been serving up soul food since 1962. Located at 328 Malcolm X Blvd, itâ€™s a must-visit for anyone wanting to experience authentic Southern comfort food in the heart of Harlem.

Food: The menu is packed with classic soul food dishes. The fried chicken is crispy and flavorful, the ribs are tender and juicy, and the mac and cheese is rich and creamy. Sides like collard greens, candied yams, and cornbread complement the mains perfectly. The portions are generous, making it a great value for the quality and quantity of food.

Atmosphere: The restaurant has a warm and welcoming vibe, with walls adorned with photos of celebrities and historical figures who have dined there. Live gospel music on Wednesday nights adds to the lively atmosphere, making it a unique dining experience.

Service: The staff is friendly and attentive, providing excellent service that makes you feel like part of the family.

Overall: Sylviaâ€™s offers a genuine taste of Harlemâ€™s culinary heritage. Whether you're a local or a visitor, itâ€™s a place where you can enjoy delicious food and immerse yourself in the rich culture of Harlem.
Food was ok but not worth the price
Excellent food

Some of the best soul food I've had in New York! The whole menu is sure to he a hit I'm sure based off what I ate. They did not miss and have a good selection! You can't go wrong here especially if you're in the mood for some good soul cooking! Did I forget to mention their food comes out steaming hot which makes it all the better!
Good, but felt it was a little overpriced for the quality and service
Harlem e il pollo fritto di Sylvia's!
Very nice

Apparently this restaurant does not need customers since they refuse to serve them for no reason.

I never had to prematurely leave a restaurant for not being served in my life before.

This was my first and last time at that restaurant.

A very disappointing and sad experience! At the end my family and me couldn't eat there and "had to leave" after having waited for our order for more than 20 minutes. Apparently one of the waitresses ignores tourists due to their physical appearence.

The legendary Sylvia's Restaurant did not disappoint. Great soul food and wonderful atmosphere. Friendly service. The many celebrity photographs on the walls attest to the enduring popularity of Sylvia's. Great lunch specials. Wonderful sweet potato pie for dessert. Legendary chicken and waffles.

Es un sitio que pareciera sacada de una pelÃ­cula. La comida estupenda sobre todo sus costillas con barbacoa!! El ambiente y la mÃºsica son inmejorables al igual que la atenciÃ³n que te dan!! No creo exista mejor sitio en Harlen para vivir esa experiencia.
Great southern food , friendly owner and staff

Sylvia's a nice place to dine if you're not vegan. Almost no vegan options. That's the only reason why I gave it one star for the food. I was one of 10 people there and the others enjoyed their food but they were not vegan. All I had was fries and water. Maybe in the future they'll consider having more vegan options including salad dressings.
soul food the real one, very good , atmosphere is nice, you can speak with the table next to you ..etc but the ac is very cold and the service is very long.
Todo delicioso y son muy atentos y amables, sin duda muy recomendable!!!
My first time going and it didn't disappoint!  We went on a Tuesday for lunch and we avoided the long waits on the weekends.   Food was very very good.
We were visiting Sylviaâ€™s at a small holiday in New York. The food was excellent and the service was even better. Definitely worth a visit.
The staff was so welcoming, and the food came out quickly. Great experience.

Enormes platos llenos de sabor.
Parece ser una vieja casona, es muy pintoresco y suena linda mÃºsica. Los platos que pedimos estaban llenos de sabores Ãºnicos. El catfish con waffle y los panecillos dulces de bienvenida estuvieron riquÃ­simos. Para beber dan agua de cortesÃ­a y pedimos un tÃ© helado con limon del cual si lo terminas te lo vuelven a completar sin cargo.
La atenciÃ³n fue excelente, atentos y sonrientes.
Short ribs, corn bread, chicken, vegetarian collard greens were great
Todos foram muito simpÃ¡ticos, comida simples e gostosa, cerveja gelada!
Great food, attentive service, and good music. Would definitely return.
I was very disappointed the food was over priced and just okay. This place is surviving on it's part glory.
Great place to eat.

One of the best meals Iâ€™ve had in New York!
The food was perfectly seasoned, served at just the right temperature, and full of flavor. The service was outstanding, and the atmosphere had such a positive, welcoming energy. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back to Sylviaâ€™s on my next trip to New York!

Service with a smile was great!  So was the hospitality.   Our waitress was pretty busy so she wasn't able to give top notch service but our needs were met.  The food... myuah!  Delicious and down home.  This will not be my last visit to Sylvia's.  We met people from the US and those visiting from abroad.  Don't skip Sylvia's!

Holly Fried Chix!!!!!!!! Wife convinced me to walk Central Park in it's Entirety (end-to-end) with Promise of having Fried Chix @ Sylvia's. 3mile walk was worth it after eating Silvia's Fried Chix Wings & Fried Chix Combo. Wife had Pork Chops Plate (1-fried & 1-grilled). All of it was Great..... Definitely coming back.

Had a breakfast meeting there. It was a good choice.
We can't wait to visit.   LYDIA
Nothing outstanding about the food. The service was great and it had live music.
This was our first time visiting.  I was GOOD.

I had a table reserved in the outside area. when the 3 others in my party canceled on me last minute and I still showed up for the reservation (I was still looking forward to my Sylvia's experience), I was downgraded by my host to a small table inside, amidst all the server traffic. When I asked if I can still sit outside at the time of being seated I was told that they had just filled up all the tables, despite my reservation I had made 4 days prior. I was confused and felt it was unfair, so I spoke up again a bit later and after some back and forth, I was told by the host I should have said something earlier, and it was too late at that point. I guess I get the short end of the stick by still showing up for my reservation. Unfortunately, I was quite disappointed with my experience here. Food was mediocre at best.
Food was decent not bad but price made it nasty lol

As residents of Harlem, Sylviaâ€™s was our go-to for soul food. Weâ€™ve dined here for 25 + years, and the customer service alongside the food quality has changed. As predicted, the server did not check on us until our bill was ready as she greeted us with jokes and a smile. As the portions have gotten smaller, the prices have risen. To the future diners of Sylviaâ€™s, do not waste your time and hard earned money. The 1 star reviews are a sad reality.
Dinner good especially Greens and catfish. Staff is very nice.

I heard this is one of well-known restaurant in Harlem and number of google reviews kinda proved it, so gave it a shot out of curiosity.

Ribs were very tender but its sauce was rather simply sweet bbq sauce so canâ€™t say it was very charming. Fried chicken was well fried with juicy meats but the fried batter was too salty for me. Overall I enjoyed the quality of meat itself but not as much for their seasonings.
